intro: Callistachys atropurpurea, commonly known as the purpleleaf honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its attractive, dark purple to bronze leaves that provide striking visual interest throughout the growing season. The plant produces small, fragrant, white to yellow flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that persist into the fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often used in landscaping and naturalized settings.
